definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
pampered son of a wealthy family
erhua variant of 八哥[ba1 ge1]

sentences.english: Two of them have become great buddies .
sentences.chinese: 他们两个变成很好的哥儿们。

sentences.english: Prudhomme and Fouillou. Paris alone has this in its natural history.
sentences.chinese: 这是呆老汉和淘哥儿，只在巴黎的自然史中才会有。

sentences.english: Beau Brummel was a noted representative of dandyism.
sentences.chinese: 蒲鲁马是出名的公子哥儿代表人物。

sentences.english: Elder brother Ye's son, you say how should this matter do?
sentences.chinese: 烨哥儿，你说这事该怎么办？

sentences.english: Mark has been Luke's sidekick since junior high school.
sentences.chinese: 打从初中开始，马克和路克一直就是哥儿俩。

sentences.english: He also advised her to open an Internet real estate company.
sentences.chinese: 这哥儿还建议她在网上开个地产公司。

sentences.english: Ge Er" is among the early works of the famous modern Japanese writer Soseki Natsume."
sentences.chinese: 《哥儿》是日本近代著名作家夏目漱石的早期作品。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly and sincerely elder brother's son will be answered criticism her with the words like this.
sentences.chinese: 没想到谨哥儿竟然会用这样的话来反驳她。

sentences.english: This time he was tipped over by his buddies.
sentences.chinese: 这次他挨了哥儿们一顿揍。

sentences.english: Paris alone has this in its natural history.
sentences.chinese: 这是呆老汉和淘哥儿，只在巴黎的自然史中才会有。

sentences.english: The friend saw everything but did not say a single word.
sentences.chinese: 这哥儿们都看在眼里，却一句话没说。

sentences.english: I met with Gavin Broadbent in Australia in 2006 and we became good buddies since then.
sentences.chinese: 盖文是我于2006年在澳大利亚结识的好哥儿们。

sentences.english: The lads at the office have sent you a post card.
sentences.chinese: 办公室的哥儿们给你寄来了明信片。
哥儿俩共用一架波音767飞机。

sentences.english: A wall clock will tell you the time of day but not its manufactured brethren.
sentences.chinese: 墙上的挂钟能告诉你时间，它的机器哥儿们却不能。

definition: (old) dowager/old lady (title for the mother of a noble or an official)
wife of mother's brother/aunt/maternal uncle's wife
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
older brother's wife/sister-in-law/(polite address to a younger married woman) sister
